section.name: Claude Bernard Diesse
section.p: Claude Bernard Diesse is a newcomer in the DMPL Community (2005), but was interrested by the Avalon framework technologies since 2003.

Born in Cameroon, were he studied in applied maths for computer science at university of Yaounde, he left in 1983 for France. After an engineering graduate of the "Institut d'Informatique d'Entreprise" (1986), and a post doctoral university degree at Paris VI (1986), he started a PhD research on IC/VLSI (integrated Circuits/Very Large Scale Integration) design and tests processes, in MASI laboratory of micro-electronics & micro-computers Department of Paris VI. But quit one year later, in favor of enterprise business oriented projects.

From 1988 to 1999, he worked for the systems and applications developement of prestigious companies and banks like La General des eaux (Vivendi) and Le Groupe des Banques CIC, where he discovered and appreciated the business world of financials institutions. In that period and through varied projects, he gain more skills in OO applications development in enterprise's business context. He found that despite all huge investments, financials institutions systems were not well adapted to to the needs of process change. Also main sub-systems in use were technologicaly outdated, and survived only by daily patches and scripts supports of last veterans developers.

So he decided to design a new smart Banking system for small community banks, running on low cost and reliable hardware, and using secure internet protocoles to expand their business around the world. The hosting environment must delivers high level component based development framework, very high reuse and runtime flexibility.

To make his smart banking system (aka Kasor Banking) project viable, he decided to migrate in Canada in 1999. He could then use Internet technology access at low cost, and learn more on the international banking processes by adding american mangement approach to the european way, and so yielding a better process-aware and process-driven banking system. Installed in Montreal area as a J2ee application architect and Senior Java/C++ developer, he took a MBA degree in financial Institutions Management ( Institut of Canadian bankers & Quebec University - ICB-ESG-UQAM) from his consultant spare time from since 2000. He gain more expertise in financials management through diferent types of banking and goverment projects.

Meanwhile, he was studying existing containers solutions and their related development framework, looking for technical characteristics such as IOC, SOA, JMX, service, remoting etc., capabilities. Avalon Merlin container seems to give on the paper, the most awaited answers. Following, Melin become Metro and now propose a new metro/FT version more suitable to his quest.
He joins dpml community to work on what will be the supporting environment of his dream's project.
When not designing or coding systems, he play or coach young guys for soccer. He also play volleyball and is auto learning piano now.
He have 2 sons who want to be professional soccer players in Europe.
